text: Bottle: Poured a bright yellow color ale with a large off-white foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of coriander with light tart notes is pretty enticing. Taste is a nice mix of coriander with light tart notes with hints of truffle notes and alight saline finish. Body is pretty full for style with great carbonation. Very drinkable example of the style with good amount of complexity.

The beer is a medium-light golden yellow color. Its somewhat hazy. Large white head, a little fizzy and fades to not much. Fairly mild aroma. Its most a citric yogurty flavor with a big, soft wheaty sweetness. Some peach. Moderately phenolic. Mild coriander. The truffle adds a nice earthy element but its pretty light. Not too exciting. A little more flavor in the taste. Mild tartness. Some citrus bitterness. Some saltiness, mostly in the aftertaste. That sweet wheat flavor makes it all very pleasant and drinkable. Good lacto flavor. Its just a bit unexciting compared to some of the new gose that have come out recently. Light but full mouthfeel. Quite soft. Mild pucker.

Bottle. Pours crystal clear golden with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is light wheat, earthy , coriander, mushrooms. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, not really goseey, but mushrooms evident. Light body, high carbonation. I am not a fan of the base gose from Upright, and it turns out that adding funguses doesnt help any. Who would have thought.

Pour out of bottle at Darkness Day 2014, hazy golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice tart lemon, salt, truffle notes come through into a bit of yeast, slight earthy, herbal notes into some bready notes, slight yeast into a bit of sour grain. Taste was a mix of earth, lemon peel, some sour fruits, vanilla into a bit of white pepper, salty notes with a hint of truffle, slight oak, finishing tart.

Bottle at James for a tasting with Ferris and Kraddel. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Big musk and funk on the nose. Medium bodied, bright acid and a bit of funk, tart and lively. Long tangy tart and a bit of acid on the finish.

Received from 2014 Secret Santa -- This was a delight to drink. Very refreshing with salt that gets your attention. Drank side-by-side with the regular Gose, and really couldnt detect a huge difference from this version to that version. This one was a little smoother and rounded, but still great. I would love to drink this again, and again, and again, and you get the point.
Bottle. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of white chocolate, sea salt, lemon and sour yeasty wheat. Medium body.

bottle shared at a tasting by tom10101, thanks bro! pours hazy/cloudy pale golden with a nice white cap showing some retention and lacing. salty coriander, lemon, mint and other herbs - some astringent, light wheaty acidulated notes along with white pepper, light acidity - mostly lactic. average carbonation - healthy; light body, lightly salted and herbal-lemony finish. good drinkability. unsure if white truffles bring some dimension/perspective/taste but it is as good as their regular gose.
Bottle. Hazy yellow pour with white head. Nice truffle, sour, tart fruit aromas. Flavors are salty, tart and truffle. Truffle being my turn off.
Bottle - Light tartness, lemon and some soap. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Soap, salt and earthy mushroom. Neat and carbonated with a light sweet finish. Oddly cool.
Pours unclear blonde, small white head . Smell is bit salty , some lemon . Taste is sweet , lemon , candy , bit grains . Sweet ending . Soft beer overall . Not really salty . Bit sour ( very hidden )

Pale and hazy. Thin head. Aroma is like their gose, with lactic freshness. This character continues on the palate, and has a balanced character. Not picking up much truffle but it has a better balance than the regular gose.

Pours a cloudy golden with a thin white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of spices and cereals, I couldnt pick any truffles through there at least. Taste is dry and lightly salty and backed by a good wheat base. Body is medium and carbonation medium-high. Overall a good offering, I didnt think it was too different from the regular one.

Bottle (750 ml) @ De Garde++ tasting. From Damon, thanks!

Appearance: Slightly hazy bright golden with a medium white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Hay, lemon, coriander, light spiciness and tartness notes.

Taste: Slightly sour with hay, lemon/citrus, coriander, light spiciness and floral notes.

Palate: Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Very mild salty finish.

Overall: It has been a while since I tried the regular Upright Gose, but this doesnt feel much different. Tasty and somewhat easy drinking. Good.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Aroma is of flowers, fruits, citrus, herbs. Taste is of perfume, citrus, flowers, coriander? Palate: Light body. Soft-medium body. Overall: Good!
Light golden amber with some foamy head. Lemony aroma. Taste is citrusy and lightly tart with a faint salt aftertaste. Not really sure i pick up anything truffle, but its nice.

Bottle. Light yellow colour with lots of frothy white head. Aroma is lemon lime, clove, and salt. Taste is citrus, orange peel, with crisp clean finish, lively carbonation, thin body. Pretty tasty stuff.
Lightly cloudy yellow color, white head. Lemons, coriander, Lactic sourness, light salt and a faint earthy component.
Clear, light golden pour. Aromas of bananas, lemon, stale bread. Flavour is wheat with coriander, salt, brown banana on the finish. Light, delicate. Really enjoyed this.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is interesting with a nice wheat character followed by some coriander and a moderately strong truffle aroma. Light stone fruit and citrus character. 
Pours a hazy, pale golden orange with a big, fluffy white head that recedes fairly quickly to a thin layer on the edges. No lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness and medium light acidity. Light stone fruit and medium light citrus character. Low coriander and phenolic notes. I dont really pick up more than a hint of the truffles and some light earthiness; this character was more prevalent in the aroma. Low and only slightly noticeable saltiness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright gose but Im not sure the truffles add anything more than an interesting note to the aroma and a background flavor. Salinity and acidity are about what I was expecting, though it could be a bit more acidic. Nice yeast character.

750Ml bottle, pours a cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out tart wheat, light salt, and light spices. Flavour brings out tart notes, some light wheaty notes, and a touch of salt. Light and refreshing, with nice tartness. Cant really detect the truffles or even much salt, but this is quite nice.
Bottle. Hazy golden orange pour, with a white head. Bready, stone fruit, salt, mild lemon sourness, notes of mushroom, and light earth. Interesting beer; light and delicate.

Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a cloudy yellow with small frothy white head. The aroma is truffle salt, oak, and floral. Thin mouthfeel with strong white truffle salt, citrus, clove, and light dry finish.

Hazy orange with a good creamy white head. Aroma is peach, apricot, white chocolate, hint of truffle. Creamy mouthfeel, medium-full bodied, smooth and balanced on the palate, very subtle tartness. Flavours are peach, apricot, white chocolate, hint of salt.

Pour is lighter golden amber with a fairly tight white head with some larger bubbles. Nose is light salt up front, a hint of grain, strong citrus behind. Taste is similar, a bit of earthiness to it, fair touch of salt, faint hint of grain, tons of citrus behind. Body is a touch of oil, softer carb and creamy feel.
Lasting white creamy thin head with a slightly cloudy, highly-carbonated amber body. Salty and tart. Okay.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours hazy brassy gold with a white head. Aroma is earthy, fruity and a hint sour. Med body, nearly. Flavor is a bit of earth, a little fruit, and detectable salt. Very nice assemblage.

Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours cloudy golden with a decent white head and an earthy dalt and fruit aroma. There is a lightly sour fruity malt flavor with a slightly salty finish, but not excessively salty like some Goses.

On tap at the brewery - This was a real treat. Pours lightly hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma was a little sweet and had floral notes, some spice and coriander. It has a light crisp lively body with mild soft carbonation. The flavor starts off with clean apple/nectar fruitiness, cream, coriander, pale malt and seems like a bit of wheat. the finish is frothy and full and shows the saltiness. Really tasty.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark gold with light head. Aromas of cilantro, fresh vegetable market, and pineapple/citrus. Some saltiness. Flavors of cilantro and salt with very nice pineapple twang and light crisp vegetables. White truffles? I dont know but a great, distinctive beer for a summer afternoon/evening.

Bottle @ 10K + OT. Thanks, Alex. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Salty, bready nose with a slight lemony tartness. Light mushroom, some cracker, and a hint of pineapple. Some white grape, as well. Taste is lightly sweet with a pleasant, but mild, sourness. Lots of bread, some cracker, and fruity, tropical esters. Good lemon zest, grape, and a subtle sea salt note. Good stuff.

Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Pours a cloudy beige-orange, decent amount of off-white head. Nose grain forward, not much truffles, some spice, esters. Body lively and crisp, finish wonderfully complex, lovely interplay between salt, truffles (theyre there, barely) and grain. More spice. Weird but good.

[ Bottle ][ dontdrinkbeer ][ 75cl ][ 10K+OT Tasting ][ Stemless Wine Taster ][ 5/3/14 ]
>> Thanks Alex for the share. Full haze straw pour, high carbonation, soda fizz foam. Sweet blueberry, strawberry, yogurt nose...fruity, parfait, pineapple. Taste is lightly salty, pineapple, anesthetic, paper. No truffle at all in anyway. Still, pretty nice overall and refreshing.

A - pours a bubbles sunshine with 1 finger fluffy head. S - the nose is simple clean aromas of wheat, sourdough, Belgian yeast. Salt water, lemon water, light honey. M - light and fluffy mf. Dry and lightly sweet. T - the taste is nice and quite clean. Light Belgian yeasts, sourdough bread, creamy yogurt, light cheese funk and cantaloupe. Light dry slightly salt end. O - nice

hazy amber, thin white ring. Light peach sourness and salt in the nose. Flavor has conflicting acidity with salt, bit of heavy truffle oil feel across finish, burdening palate while contributing only slightly to flavor.

Draft at upright. Pours a cloudy medium gold with a dense and fizzy white head. Bright tangy nose, a little plummy, a little earthy. Crisp lively light body. Earthy fruity tang on the mid palate with a light plummy finish. Love this beer.

750ml bottle pours a bright hazed yellow with a firm white head. Aroma is unique. Its subtle citrus, nutty earthiness, and some barnyard but I really dont get much White Truffle?? The salt component give it a brine quality that I really enjoy and it plays well with the tart dry finish. Really soft and delicate, awesome beer, I will buy more.

On tap at the brewery. Cask. Pours a cloudy copper color with a medium white head. A funky earthy nose, some lemons, spices. The flavor is more grains, light coriander, salt, a bit of cereal, very drinkable. A bit of citrus fruit and funk. Good.
